page.title: 20THE POLICEMAN
page.content: The policeman has lived in the{police {house}Belchamp St.Paul for 19 years. At first he had to patrol six villages on a{bicycle}and report by telephone. Later he had a silent{motor-cycle}with a radio and took on three more. Then he had a{mini-van}to cover four extra. Now he has a Vauxhall Chevette with a {radio}he can use up to two miles from his{car}and have access to the main police{computer}at headquarters in Chelmsford. This instant communication makes police work more effective, but in the days of the bicycle he was able to know everybody extremely well. The recent most serious crime was a {burglary}at the village Post Office shop. Burglars broke windows and the front door and took the safe. They stole tools from the bus, broke open the safe in Mashay Wood and stole thousands of pounds.They are in{prison
